You're already consistent with your wake-up time, which is a great start! Breaking the snooze button habit can be challenging, but don't worry, I've got some tips to help you overcome it:

1. **Place your alarm clock far from your bed**: This will force you to get out of bed to turn it off, making it harder to hit the snooze button. Try placing it on a dresser or across the room.
2. **Use a smart alarm clock or app**: Invest in a smart alarm clock or download an app that can monitor your sleep patterns and wake you up during a light sleep phase. This can help you feel more refreshed and less groggy in the morning.
3. **Set a "get out of bed" goal**: Instead of focusing on waking up, set a goal to get out of bed within a certain time frame, say 10-15 minutes after waking up. This will help you build momentum and make it easier to start your day.
4. **Create a wake-up routine**: Develop a consistent morning routine that you enjoy, such as stretching, meditating, or reading. This will give you something to look forward to and make it easier to get out of bed.
5. **Use the 2-minute rule**: When your alarm goes off, give yourself 2 minutes to slowly open your eyes, take a few deep breaths, and think about your day ahead. This can help you mentally prepare to get out of bed.
6. **Make mornings enjoyable**: Find something you love to do in the morning, such as sipping a favorite coffee or tea, listening to music, or watching a funny video. This will create a positive association with waking up and make it easier to get out of bed.
7. **Get some accountability**: Share your struggles with a friend or family member and ask them to hold you accountable. You can even schedule a morning call or meetup to provide an added motivation to get out of bed.
8. **Try the "5-second rule"**: When your alarm goes off, count down from 5 and then immediately get out of bed. This can help you build discipline and make it a habit to get out of bed quickly.
9. **Use a "no snooze" rule**: Make a rule for yourself that you're not allowed to hit the snooze button. This can be a mental challenge, but it can help you build self-discipline and break the habit.
10. **Reward yourself**: Set small rewards for yourself when you successfully get out of bed without hitting the snooze button. This could be something as simple as a favorite breakfast or a short break during the day.

Remember, breaking the snooze button habit takes time and effort. Be patient with yourself, and don't get discouraged if you don't see immediate results. Keep working at it, and you'll eventually develop the habit of getting out of bed feeling refreshed and ready to start your day!
